content: the text discusses a legal case involving two individuals referred to as mr mh and mr cj who have decided to proceed with a divorce by mutual consent they have made agreements regarding the division of their property and assets including tangible and intangible movable property settlement of reciprocal rights and division of rental property and real estate they have also made agreements regarding the custody and residence of their minor children and have agreed to share the costs and fees related to the divorce proceedings the agreements will have legal effect once the divorce decree becomes final they have chosen to file their joint petition for divorce in a specific family court the notary involved in the case referred to as master h has special obligations to declare any conflicting interests and unbalanced clauses inform the parties of their rights and obligations and provide impartial advice the parties confirm that they consider the clauses in the deed to be balanced and have accepted them the notary confirms the authenticity of the partners civil status based on official documents the parties declare that they have full legal capacity and have received and read a draft deed before the meeting the deed was signed by the parties in the presence of the notary
